articles.author: Anumeha Chaturvedi
articles.title: Oyo tells employees it expects nearly Rs 800 crore adjusted EBITDA in FY24 - Economic Times
articles.description: People familiar with the matter said Agarwal told staffers during the town hall that this can be attributed to 'sustained growth' in India, Indonesia, the US and UK besides ‘relevant optimisations and ‘synergies in the European vacation homes market.
articles.content: Oyo founder Ritesh Agarwal told employees in an internal town hall on Monday that it expects to clock adjusted EBITDA of nearly Rs 800 crore in the upcoming financial year 2024.The companys current c… [+3368 chars]
